Key Match Events: Edmond Tapsoba scored an own goal within three minutes at the start of the match
Lassine Sinayoko netted his third goal of the tournament two minutes after the break
Bertrand Traore slotted a penalty just before the hour-mark
Post-Match Reflections: Mali sealed quarterfinal place with 2-1 win over Burkina Faso
Mali are seeking their first Africa Cup of Nations title and next face hosts Ivory Coast in a quarterfinal
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mali scored within three minutes at the start of the match and again two minutes after the break
No team has played more games at the Cup of Nations without lifting the trophy than Mali's 55
Others: Mali's Amadou Haidara's powerful header rebounded off the post and led to Edmond Tapsoba's own goal
Hamari Traor√© played Lassine Sinayoko into acres of space on the right side of the box for his goal
Ibrahim Mutaz awarded a spot kick following a Video Assistant Referee review for Burkina Faso's penalty
The match was played at the Stade Amadou Gon Coulibaly in Korhogo on Tuesday
